meanings.definition: A person responsible for the supervision of a particular place or group.
meanings.sent1: The wardens at the school ensure everyone follows the rules.
meanings.sent2: The park wardens keep an eye on the visitors to maintain safety.
meanings.sent3: The wardens organizing the picnic were very serious about the sandwich competition.
meanings.sent4: The wardens of the forest guided the lost travelers back to the main path.
meanings.sent5: The wardens of the museum carefully protect the valuable artifacts.

meanings.definition: A device used to protect or control access to something.
meanings.sent1: The security system had multiple wardens to prevent unauthorized entry.
meanings.sent2: The gate had electronic wardens that only allowed authorized personnel through.
meanings.sent3: The wardens on the door beeped loudly whenever someone tried to enter without permission.
meanings.sent4: The digital wardens of the computer network blocked any suspicious activity.
meanings.sent5: The magical wardens around the castle kept intruders at bay.

meanings.sent1: The grocery store had a sale on wardens, a sweet and juicy fruit.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for ripe wardens to add a delicious flavor to the dish.
meanings.sent3: The warden pear rolled off the table and caused a comical chase around the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The warden pear stood out among the other fruits with its unique shape.
meanings.sent5: The warden pear tree in the backyard provided a bountiful harvest every year.
